intro: Amaracarpus malaspinae, commonly known as the Malaspina amara, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves and produces small, pale yellow flowers. It is often found in moist, shaded habitats within the undergrowth of tropical forests. Due to its limited distribution and specific ecological requirements, it is considered a rare and relatively understudied species.
